intro: Clidemia calvescens, commonly known as the velvetleaf or silverleaf plant, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and Central America. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Clidemia calvescens is also known for its rapid growth and ability to form dense thickets, making it an invasive species in some areas.
